Best repertoire training app for android. I had some issues when importing pgn games created with Chessbase 15. But cleaning the pgn‚Äôs first with SCID solved the problem. I have two request for future updates. 1.) I would like to order the variations by popularity so the most common played variations are on top. Maybe based on the imported pgn or maybe even better based on some big reference database with opening theory. 2.) In Study Mode I want to be able to make a move, (or moves) on the board that is, (are) not in the repertoire. To check if the move, (or moves) transposes back to positions in the repertoire. Then if they do I want to bookmark the position, (before the transposition), to add the moves later in Prepare Mode. At the moment this is not possible because I get the message Study Mode is ‚Äòread only‚Äô. I want it to stay ‚Äòread only‚Äô, but I want to be able to execute the moves, to check if they transpose back to my repertoire, maybe some moves later.

Best Opening app for me! I just want to suggest to add ability to comment on specific sequence of move only. For example, the comment wont show up if the same position was reached through a different sequence.

What is the difference of position comment and repertoire comment?
replyContent:
Hi Classi,
Position comment is global to the app. The comment is visible to all openings in that particular position. Repertoire comment on the other hand is exclusive to a particular opening only. Please contact us at ayelmarc.info@gmail.com if you have other questions. Thanks for your 5-star rating.

content: How to use different colour arrows?
replyContent:
Hi Hit,
If you are in PGN Mode or Prepare Mode, just long press on the chess board to show pop-up menu. Select Actvate Board Marking. Press one of the three colors and drag on chess board from source to destination square. When you're done click on CLOSE button.

1) Go to Main Menu „ÄãSettings „ÄãPGN „ÄãPGN Settings „ÄãPGN Load and enable or disable items according to your preference. 2) You just look at the Selected Node Area above the buttons to see which item is currently selected. 3) Settings page has 4 categories namely: REPERTOIRE, GENERAL APPEARANCE, GENERAL BEHAVIOR, and PGN. 4) Dark mode is i
